Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
piggybacking
1. A method for passing {acknowledgement frame}s and {data frame}s in the same direction along a line.
2. The practice of increasing memory capacity by soldering chips on top of other chips. The chip-enable or high address pins would be connected to the {address bus} by a flying lead. Many {Ohio Superboard}s were expanded to a massive 8K of {RAM} in this way.
(1994-11-29)
